entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (28)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (28)20130203
I played today for about five and a half hours.

I completed Zhonecage and did almost all the Inn requests by
grinding shards in Zhonecage. The only things left are to do that
last Katz Korner requests, fight the Gentlemen, then fight Lambda
Theos. I checked and my grade is now 2907. I just need a little
bit more so I can get the best carry-overs. Some carry-overs don't
seem very useful, such as half of my money or the battle items,
because with so much more gald per battle, I don't think I'll
really need it. Plus I only have about 300k in the bank because of
dualizing. (Although perhaps the best thing to do is sell
everything before you New Game+?)

In the evening I played for another hour and a half-ish. I beat
Lambda Theos and got a few more of the Katz requests. I tried
Zhonecage 10 again so I could get the Darkened Ore and didn't get
it. Very frustrating. I'm nearing the end.

Total time: 105:30
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Graces f
  • PS3
  • 2010

entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (27)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (27)20130202
I played this morning for about three and half hours. I made some
more attempts to gather stuff in the process of dualizing for
floor 10. I decided to clear the game on the other difficulties. I
did Moderate and Evil. I haven't done the 60 seconds or the Chaos
difficulty though. I'm not confident I can. Also, I decided to
check my grade: 2719. I can get basically everything except
Skills and x3 SP.

In the afternoon, I played for about an hour and decided to try
and farm shards in Zhonecage for the kinds of shards I needed for
the inn requests. This was very successful.


In the evening, I continued that for about an hour.  I think there
are only two or three more requests I need to do. I also think
there's just one more upgrade before I can hit floor 10.

Total time: 98:26

entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (25)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (25)20130131
Today I worked on getting to the top of the Zhonecage. My plan is
dualize Malik's final weapon (because I don't normally use him
and his was the first sphere I got) while grinding on the earlier
Zhonecage levels (that I don't have the spheres from) until it is
worth enough.

Using that plan today, I got the spheres for everyone but Asbel
and got the Purebright Cloth. The amount of stuff I need from
Zhonecage is much smaller now... although I will need to fight the
Dark Turtlez more to get the Turtlez Togz. I was able to do Level
9, but its not enough to get to level 10. Painful.

I can't decide if I should do the rest of Riot Peak now or after
I do level 10.

Total time: 91:23
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Graces f
  • PS3
  • 2010

entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (24)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (24)20130130
Today I played for about three hours at various times in the
day. I got to the end of the 8th floor of the Zhonecage, but
haven't gotten an expensive enough item to get to the 9th
floor. I was about to get the spheres for Malik and Pascal, which
is pretty exciting. I'll be working at getting the other ones. I
really dislike grinding for random items (in general), so I feel
like I might give up get 100% everything in this game because it
will be necessary to grind shards and these spheres to get
everything. That's so annoying. I really dislike it when games
make you play in a way that makes you hate them at the end. I'm
fine with random drops, but the chance should be high enough that
after beating the game, you should have a few of everything from
fighting them throughout the game.

Total time: 89:08
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Graces f
  • PS3
  • 2010

entry.title: Book: Apollo's Angels, by Jennifer Homans (2010) (14)
entry.content:
Book: Apollo's Angels, by Jennifer Homans (2010) (14)20130130
I finished the book today. The end is a little depressing and too
name-drop-y without enough explanation. I was hoping a bit more
for a study of how ballet got its place in American culture, like
why Americans love the Nutcracker, etc.

In any case, I liked the book a lot.

  • 2010

entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (23)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (23)20130129
This afternoon I played for about two hours and began trying to
get as much 100% stuff as I can. I initially tried to kill the
last boss in 60 secs but didn't come really close even on Easy. I
think I need to buff up a lot more.

I then made a list of all the various items I hadn't yet collected
so I could begin getting them. This required, among other things,
going back to World's Eye to get some more Legendary Metal, which
was very painful. But I tricked the game by Saving & Loading to
get the Discovery to regenerate.

I took a break for a while and played again in the evening for an
hour and a half. I went to Zhonecage and beat levels 1, 2,
and 3. I accidentally set my difficulty to Easy a few times and
then Chaos for the others (but I should have just done Evil, since
I want the Spheres.) This means I've got to do those levels again
if I want them. Bummer.

Total time: 85:51
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Graces f
  • PS3
  • 2010

entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (22)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (22)20130128
I played for about five hours today. For the first thing, I
beat Poisson, using basically the same technique as last time,
but she didn't get to use her Mystic Artes on me, so I won.

During the session there were a lot of cute skits. There was a
great one of Hubert complaining about how scandalous Richard's
final battle costume was; one where Cheria thought she was too fat
and broke the elevator because she had a sweet potato; one where
Lambda tells Pascal to figure something out herself and then ruins
her discovery by revealing it at the last moment. It's great
stuff. :) An odd thing I noticed today in a lot of the scenes was
that Lords, Kings, Leaders, etc all have lots of paperwork to do
and it defines their life. I think game was made in Japan. :)

I did the final dungeon and final battle. The very last area was
very beautiful and the last battle was pretty insane. I loved the
whole counter thing, although I'm not sure how you'd know to do
it.

The ending is nice. I think Sophie's new getup looks
awesome... too bad it doesn't unlock a title so you can have her
like that all the time. I also thought the resolution of the
various romances was sweet.

I loaded up New Game+ to see what my grade was: 1774. I think I
can do a little bit more dualizing, plus some of the EX Dungeon
to get it higher. I intend to do that. Unfortunately, I missed
some skits and side-quests early on, so I can't possibly get
those 100%. Grr.

Total time: 81:58
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Graces f
  • PS3
  • 2010

entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (21)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (21)20130127
In the morning I played for about two hours and a half. I am
really enjoying all the skits about Hubert and Pascal. It is very
cute. I especially like how dense Asbel and Pascal are about it.

I like the resolution of the Asbel/Sophie plot and I'm glad it's
not romantic. It's pretty adorable though.

--

Later in the morning I played for about two hours and got through
the confusing garden and fought the Little Queen. What a strange
character.

--

In the evening I played for about two hours and went through the
post-Little Queen sequence. I liked going around having Lambda
talk to everyone. The voice actor sounds like someone from Metal
Gear, but I can't place who.

I loved the skit with Pascal singing. It was so ridiculous.

I tried to do the Master Class Riot Peak trial, but died at
Poisson at the end... when she was almost dead and she was doing a
Mystic Arts. I'm not sure if I got the prizes, because there was
no mention of anything afterwards, unlike usual. I think I will
try again and go into Accel mode when she has a break.

Total time: 76:58
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Graces f
  • PS3
  • 2010

entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (20)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (20)20130126
Today in the morning I played for almost six hours with a bunch
of little breaks. I basically just did the last dungeon, but I
popped out once to do a few more requests and side quests.

I found it really interesting during the final moments of the game
to learn more about Lambda and how he was created and lived.

The side quest with the sick girl and the dolls was very cute and
had a nice twist in its ending. I also liked how one of the dolls
was the Prince from Katamari.

Two of my favourite skits so far were: when Asbel asks Pascal how
she got from the Amarcian Enclave to where the group was. Her
explanation was ridiculous. The other was when Pascal says that
Cheria is "chubbing out" and then her reaction to that comment.

I picked a fun set of costumes for my characters by the end of the
game: Sophie's pirate outfit, Cheria's new dress, Pascal's
swimsuit, Asbel's black outfit, and the two 'modern' outfits for
Malik and Hubert. I think they're all the best ones.

The last boss was very hard. I tried first on Chaos and got him to
half his health before running out of Elixirs and being
decimated. I next tried Evil and almost won but it was pretty
rough, so I decided when I tried again I'd do Hard. I did it that
time and got the Hard trophy (but not the Moderate
one... annoying.) A key I discovered was using the Hourglass
after his Mystic Artes had killed so many characters.

The ending was pretty intense and had a surprising resolution.

--

All together, it took my 68 hours and 18 minutes to get to the
"end" of the game. Of course, there's the Lineage & Legacies
expansion, so I'm doing that too and will consider that to be the
actual end of the game.

It's pretty cool so far. My favourite skits have been the ones
about marriage. It's so cute that all of Asbel's proposals remind
him of Cheria and Cheria's crazy dream about their wedding day.

I don't yet understand the Accel system and I'm surprised that any
of the other characters would be able to use it given the story
explanation for its existence.

Total time: 70:43
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Graces f
  • PS3
  • 2010

entry.title: Movie: Ecstasy of Order: The Tetris Masters, directed by Adam Cornelius (2011)
entry.content:
Movie: Ecstasy of Order: The Tetris Masters, directed by Adam Cornelius (2011)20130126
This was an amazing movie. I really enjoyed how positive and cool
all the people were, as opposed to some of the depressing people
in the other gaming movies I've seen.

I really enjoyed the diversity of the different players and I
think it speaks to how much of a phenomenon Tetris is that there
are players for so many different backgrounds.

I was very impressed and happy that Thor was actually still a
skilled Tetris player and not just posturing.

It blew my mind when they talked about the Invisible Tetris mode
and the kid's ability to last for a minute. That's insane.
  • Movies
  • 2011

the Master Class Riot Peak Trial, but died at the last boss

surprised at how differently they all played.

entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (17)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (17)20130123
I spent the majority of the night (about three hours) doing side
quests and satisfying requests. I'm now going down the list of
discoveries to make sure I have the ones I can before I move on to
the story. I think I can't really be near the end because there's
a lot of stuff I don't have the ability to do yet. I think it is
kind of ridiculous how you need so many crystals and can only get
them through the mixer or playing again (I presume?)

I was thinking today about how the explanation of why Sophie
appeared in the field and later disappeared. In the beginning it
seems crazy, but I think the explanation is suitably interesting.

Total time: 60:57

  • Tales of Graces f
  • PS3

entry.title: Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (16)
entry.content:
Game: Tales of Graces f (PS3, 2010) (16)20130122
In the afternoon, I played for about two hours and in the evening
I played for about three. I spent the whole time unlocking places
in the Shuttle and doing side quests. A lot of the side quests
don't seem to be as meaningful as I was hoping, but the story
tidbits are interesting. I enjoyed the puzzles in the Sandshroud
Ruins; I enjoyed the play; I enjoy Pascal's ridiculous groping
animation whenever possible; Katz Korner is crazy; etc. Some of
the story bits are harder to appreciate because they have no
voice, which is only odd because the rest of the game does. I
think I'm getting towards the end of the side quests, and thus
I'll go to the end of the game soon.

Total time: 57:45
  • Video Games
  • Tales of Graces f
  • PS3
  • 2010
